sentence.Network_en: Single parents are more likely to be permissive.
sentence.Network_cn: 单亲家庭的父母更容易放任自己的孩子。

sentence.Network_en: First, about 50,000 " old " pesticides had been registered under permissive pre - 1972 safety and testing requirements.
sentence.Network_cn: 第一, 大约5万种 “ 旧的 ” 杀虫剂按照1972年以前容许的可靠性和检查要求进行了注册.

sentence.Network_en: These cells exhibited the glycopetide pattern characteristic of transformed cells when grown at the permissive temperature.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些细胞在许可的温度下生长时,具有转化细胞所特有的糖肽图谱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'tolerated, allowed'): from Old French, or from medieval Latin permissivus, from permiss- 'allowed', from the verb permittere (see permit)

entry.def: A permissive person, society, or way of behaving allows or tolerates things which other people disapprove of.

example.ex: Single parents are more likely to be permissive.
example.tran: 单亲家庭的父母更容易放任自己的孩子。

means.word_mean: 2. granting or inclined or able to grant permission; not strict in discipline;

sentences.sentence: "direct primary legislation is largely permissive rather than prescriptive"
